description: From Middle English sekar, sekere (also sechar, sechere), equivalent to seek +‎ -er. Compare Saterland Frisian Säiker (“seeker”), West Frisian syker (“seeker”), Dutch zoeker (“seeker”), German Low German Söker (“seeker”), German Sucher (“seeker”).

entries.meaning: Especially, a religious seeker: a pilgrim, or one who aspires to enlightenment or salvation.
In the sport of Quidditch or Muggle quidditch, a player who attempts to catch the snitch.
